briefdescription.para: Digest authentication requested.
Client certificate requested.

Do not use any mechanism to pass through firewalls.
Use the specified public adress.
Use a STUN server to get the public address.
Use the ICE protocol.
Use the uPnP protocol.
Policy to use to pass through firewalls.
Lime is not used at all.
Lime is always used.
Lime is used only if we already shared a secret with remote.

briefdescription.para: Sets the UDP port used for audio streaming.

detaileddescription.para:
A value of -1 will request the system to allocate the local port randomly. This is recommended in order to avoid firewall warnings.

LinphoneCore object
port
The UDP port to use for audio streaming

briefdescription.para: Sets the UDP port to be used by SIP.

parameterdescription.para: The UDP port to be used by SIP

briefdescription.para: Gets the UDP port used by SIP.

simplesect.para: The UDP port used by SIP

briefdescription.para: Sets the ports to be used for each of transport (UDP or TCP) A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used.

detaileddescription.para:
A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be choosen randomly by the system.
lc
LinphoneCore object
transports
A LinphoneSipTransports structure giving the ports to use
0 Deprecated
Use linphone_core_set_transports instead

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the port configuration used for each transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used. A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be chosen randomly by the system.
lc
LinphoneCore object
transports
A #LinphoneSipTransports structure that will receive the configured ports
0 Deprecated

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the real port number assigned for each sip transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value means that the transport is not activated. If LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM was passed to linphone_core_set_sip_transports(), the random port choosed by the system is returned.
lc
LinphoneCore object
tr
A #LinphoneSipTransports structure that will receive the ports being used
Deprecated
Use linphone_core_get_transports_used instead

briefdescription.para: Sets the ports to be used for each of transport (UDP or TCP) A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used.

detaileddescription.para:
A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be choosen randomly by the system.
lc
LinphoneCore object
transports
A LinphoneSipTransports structure giving the ports to use
0

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the port configuration used for each transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value port for a given transport means the transport is not used. A value of LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM (-1) means the port is to be chosen randomly by the system.
lc
LinphoneCore object
A LinphoneTransports structure with the configured ports

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the real port number assigned for each sip transport (udp, tcp, tls).

detaileddescription.para:
A zero value means that the transport is not activated. If LC_SIP_TRANSPORT_RANDOM was passed to linphone_core_set_sip_transports(), the random port choosed by the system is returned.
lc
LinphoneCore object
A LinphoneTransports structure with the ports being used

briefdescription.para: Return the external ip address of router.

detaileddescription.para: In some cases the uPnP can have an external ip address but not a usable uPnP (state different of Ok).

briefdescription.para: This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method with true trigger linphone to initiate a registration process for all proxies. Calling this method disables the automatic network detection mode. It means you must call this method after each network state changes.

briefdescription.para: return network state either as positioned by the application or by linphone itself.
This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when the SIP network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: This is for advanced usage, when SIP and RTP layers are required to use different interfaces. Most applications just need linphone_core_set_network_reachable().

briefdescription.para: This method is called by the application to notify the linphone core library when the media (RTP) network is reachable.

detaileddescription.para: This is for advanced usage, when SIP and RTP layers are required to use different interfaces. Most applications just need linphone_core_set_network_reachable().

briefdescription.para: Enables signaling keep alive, small udp packet sent periodically to keep udp NAT association.

briefdescription.para: Is signaling keep alive enabled.

simplesect.para: A boolean value telling whether signaling keep alive is enabled

briefdescription.para: Set http proxy address to be used for signaling during next channel connection.

Use linphone_core_set_network_reachable FASLE/TRUE to force channel restart.

LinphoneCore object
host
Hostname of IP adress of the http proxy (can be NULL to disable).

briefdescription.para: Sets a TLS certificate used for TLS authentication The certificate won't be stored, you have to set it after each LinphoneCore startup.
Sets a TLS key used for TLS authentication The key won't be stored, you have to set it after each LinphoneCore startup.
Sets a TLS certificate path used for TLS authentication The path will be stored in the rc file and automatically restored on startup.
Sets a TLS key path used for TLS authentication The path will be stored in the rc file and automatically restored on startup.
Gets the TLS certificate.

simplesect.para: the TLS certificate or NULL if not set yet

briefdescription.para: Gets the TLS key.

simplesect.para: the TLS key or NULL if not set yet

briefdescription.para: Gets the path to the TLS certificate file.

simplesect.para: the TLS certificate path or NULL if not set yet

briefdescription.para: Gets the path to the TLS key file.

simplesect.para: the TLS key path or NULL if not set yet

briefdescription.para: Clear a NAT policy (deactivate all protocols and unset the STUN server).
Tell whether STUN is enabled.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling whether STUN is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable STUN.

detaileddescription.para:
If TURN is also enabled, TURN will be used instead of STUN.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
enable
Boolean value telling whether to enable STUN.

briefdescription.para: Tell whether TURN is enabled.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling whether TURN is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable TURN.

detaileddescription.para:
If STUN is also enabled, it is ignored and TURN is used.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
enable
Boolean value telling whether to enable TURN.

briefdescription.para: Tell whether ICE is enabled.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling whether ICE is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable ICE.

detaileddescription.para:
ICE can be enabled without STUN/TURN, in which case only the local candidates will be used.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
enable
Boolean value telling whether to enable ICE.

briefdescription.para: Tell whether uPnP is enabled.

simplesect.para: Boolean value telling whether uPnP is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable uPnP.

detaileddescription.para:
This has the effect to disable every other policies (ICE, STUN and TURN).
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
enable
Boolean value telling whether to enable uPnP.

Used when STUN or TURN are enabled.

stun_server
The STUN server to use with this NAT policy.

briefdescription.para: Get the username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

detaileddescription.para:
The authentication will search for a LinphoneAuthInfo with this username. If it is not set the username of the currently used LinphoneProxyConfig is used to search for a LinphoneAuthInfo.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
The username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

briefdescription.para: Set the username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.

detaileddescription.para:
The authentication will search for a LinphoneAuthInfo with this username. If it is not set the username of the currently used LinphoneProxyConfig is used to search for a LinphoneAuthInfo.
policy
LinphoneNatPolicy object
username
The username used to authenticate with the STUN/TURN server.
